div.p: SANICLLA, SanICLE , or Self-heal, in botany: A genus of the digynia order, belonging to the pentandria claſs of plants; and in the natural method ranking under the 45th order, Umbellate. The umbel's are cloſe together, almoſt in a round head; the fruit is ſcabrous; the flowers of the diſk abortive. There are three ſpecies, viz. the canadenſis, marilandica, and europæa, found in many parts both of Scotland and England. This plant was long celebrated for its healing virtues; but it is now totally diſregarded.
